{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infant has conjunctivitis that later developed into respiratory distress and pneumonia. The chest X-ray showed bilateral lung infiltrates. The WBC count is elevated at 14,300/dL. Based on these findings, the most likely organism is Haemophilus influenzae. Haemophilus influenzae is a common cause of respiratory infections in infants and can cause conjunctivitis as well. It is known to cause pneumonia with bilateral lung infiltrates on chest X-ray. The elevated WBC count is consistent with an inflammatory response to the infection.", "answer_choice": "D"}
